notorious.name: Pets.com
notorious.description: Iconic failure, sock puppet mascot, crashed in less than 2 years.

notorious.name: Webvan
notorious.description: Online grocery delivery, burned through $1B+ and went bankrupt.

notorious.name: eToys
notorious.description: Online toy store, went bust after the holiday season flop.

notorious.name: Kozmo.com
notorious.description: Promised 1-hour delivery of anything... without charging delivery fees.

notorious.name: Boo.com
notorious.description: Fashion e-commerce site that burned through $135M in 18 months.

notorious.name: TheGlobe.com
notorious.description: Social networking before social networking was a thing.

notorious.name: Broadcast.com
notorious.description: Acquired by Yahoo for $5.7B, made Mark Cuban rich.

notorious.name: Flooz.com
notorious.description: Digital currency before crypto, endorsed by Whoopi Goldberg.

notorious.name: AllAdvantage
notorious.description: Paid users to surf the web with ad toolbars.

notorious.name: Infospace
notorious.description: Inflated valuation; later investigated for fraud.

notorious.name: Excite@Home
notorious.description: Once a major search engine + ISP combo, filed for bankruptcy.

notorious.name: Beenz.com
notorious.description: Internet currency competitor to Flooz.

notorious.name: AltaVista
notorious.description: Search engine, acquired by Yahoo, got overshadowed by Google.

notorious.name: NetZero
notorious.description: Free internet access provider, still somehow alive in small form.

notorious.name: Xoom.com
notorious.description: Online utilities billing/payment, not related to modern Xoom (PayPal).

notorious.name: CyberRebate
notorious.description: Promised 100% rebates... until it didn't.

notorious.name: Open Market
notorious.description: Early e-commerce platform, stock soared, then crashed.

notorious.name: Egghead.com
notorious.description: Software/hardware seller, eventually went bankrupt.

notorious.name: VerticalNet
notorious.description: Industry-specific B2B marketplaces, overhyped.

notorious.name: Value America
notorious.description: Retailer promising everything under the sun, failed to deliver.

notorious.name: DrKoop.com
notorious.description: Health website launched by a former U.S. Surgeon General.

notorious.name: Buy.com
notorious.description: Massive discounts, bleeding money, still exists today (kinda).

survivors.name: Yahoo
survivors.description: Boomed and busted but still limps along (now owned by Apollo).

survivors.name: Amazon
survivors.description: Survived and dominated. Took massive losses early on.

survivors.name: eBay
survivors.description: One of the few dotcoms that thrived after the crash.

survivors.name: Google
survivors.description: Technically founded in 1998, IPO'd in 2004 â€” missed the bubble burst.

survivors.name: Oracle
survivors.description: Was around pre-bubble but had a wild ride during it.

survivors.name: Cisco
survivors.description: Market cap plummeted during the crash, but still relevant.

survivors.name: AOL
survivors.description: Huge in the early internet era, merged with Time Warner in a disastrous deal.

survivors.name: Red Hat
survivors.description: Survived and thrived in enterprise Linux; acquired by IBM later.

survivors.name: Ask Jeeves
survivors.description: Search engine with a butler mascot; now Ask.com.

survivors.name: Lycos
survivors.description: Search engine turned media site, changed ownership several times.
